properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:47PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...ADDITIONAL SNOW EXPECTED MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING...

.Light high elevation snow will gradually diminish this evening,
with light accumulations possible above 3500 feet. However,
another round of light to moderate snow accumulations is expected
Monday through Tuesday morning. Snow level elevations will
fluctuate considerably throughout the event, likely from between
2000 to 3500 feet. Regardless, many local interior highways will
see snow accumulations in higher elevations, including Highways
299, 3, and 26. An additional, much stronger storm will also bring
heavier snow to the region Wednesday and Thursday.

* WHAT...Snowfall of 1 to 3 inches is expected above 3500 feet in
elevation Sunday evening. Additional snow accumulations of 3 to
6 inches possible above 2500 feet in elevation Monday through
early Tuesday.

* WHERE...Northern Trinity County.

* WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 PM PST
this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 1
PM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow accumulations may create
slippery conditions on high elevation roadways.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING ABOVE 3500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY
